page.title: 03ROADSIDE SHOP
page.content: { Roadside shop}is situated in the centre of{Lady village.}It is owned by Jimmy Walls and his wife Marjory. It offers{"self-service"}and is licensed to sell alcoholic liquor. There are five sections. One has{meat and veg., one has{sweets,}a third{tinned goods like salmon, fruit and meat. The remaining ones have{papers}and{bread. If you walk through the shop you will come, on your left, to the area where papers are kept. Across from this is the garage with the{drinks store behind. On the right is where the soft drinks and frozen foods are stored, with the{drapery and haberdashery}dept (which is also self-service) behind. Upstairs is found{footwear}and{toys. The van kept in the garage delivers orders to Burness and the South-end on Mondays and Thursdays respectively.
